chapter.title: Doing More with Spin
chapter.para: Now that you have created your basic samba-server.appliance, you can customize your appliance through additional elements in the appliance definition file. When selecting packages, you may want certain events to occur depending upon what package version is installed or deinstalled. Scripts that run automatically or are triggered upon certain installation or deinstallation events give you more power over the sequence of events and combination of packages. You can also automate your appliance by including a kickstart file. Spin also accomodates your preferences for media and kernel boot arguments. If your company's legal department or custom software development department requires certain content, you can include those components, as well.

Updating your appliance is easy with Spin, but you need to understand whether the client system or just the appliance repository or both will include any updates. The next chapter addresses that critical issue.
